description:
$ uname -m
i686
$ euca-describe-images ami-00000002
IMAGE   ami-00000002    ttylinux-uec-images/ttylinux-uec-snapshot.img.manifest.xml               available       private         x86_64  machine                 instance-store
$ euca-run-instances --key mykey ami-00000002
RESERVATION     r-d74jh0qr      test-project    default
INSTANCE        i-00000002      ami-00000002                    scheduling      mykey    0               m1.small        2011-08-25T04:47:52Z    unknown zone    ami-00000000     ami-00000000
$ euca-describe-instances i-00000002
RESERVATION     r-d74jh0qr      test-project    default
INSTANCE        i-00000002      ami-00000002    11.0.0.3        11.0.0.3        shutdown mykey   0               m1.small        2011-08-25T04:47:52Z    nova    ami-00000000     ami-00000000


nova-compute.log shows an error like:
2011-08-25 04:47:53,889 ERROR nova.compute.manager [-] Instance '2' failed to spawn. Is virtualization enabled in the BIOS? Details: [Errno 2] No such file or directory

I realize this isn't that big of a deal, but I just lost a bunch of time trouble shooting it it and I should be sleeping.

ProblemType: Bug
DistroRelease: Ubuntu 11.10
Package: nova-compute-lxc 2011.3~d4~20110812.1417-0ubuntu1
ProcVersionSignature: User Name 3.0.0-9.14-virtual 3.0.3
Uname: Linux 3.0.0-9-virtual i686
Architecture: i386
Date: Thu Aug 25 04:46:39 2011
NovaConf: Error: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/etc/nova/nova.conf'
PackageArchitecture: all
ProcEnviron:
 LANG=en_US.UTF-8
 SHELL=/bin/bash
SourcePackage: nova
UpgradeStatus: No upgrade log present (probably fresh install)
title: lxc in nova will happily attempt to run x86_64 container on i686 arch

comments.content: Chuck submitted a merge proposal for fixing this at https://review.openstack.org/#change,891 .

comments.content: The merge proposal failed... is this bug still valid?
